page.title: 05Farming - Livestock
page.content: The livestock of the area are mainly sheep, which have been predominant for hundreds of years. These are closely followed by beef stock and dairy herds of cattle. Many of the smaller farmers have recently changed from dairy to fatstock as this is proving more economic for them. The milk from the dairy cows is pumped directly into a sterilised tank and collected daily from the farms. There are also 2 goat-keepers in the area who sell goats' milk and the cheese made from it. There is one moth farm where rare moths are bred and the larvae exported to many parts of the world. Commercial beekeeping, horticultural and garden centres also thrive. By Mrs N Butterworth
